trans-unit.source: Authenticating Azure Insights requests
trans-unit.target: Authenticating Azure Insights requests

trans-unit.source: All of the tasks that you do on Azure Insights resources must be authenticated with Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: All of the tasks that you do on Azure Insights resources must be authenticated with Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: The easiest way to do this is to use PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: The easiest way to do this is to use PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: If you don’t have access to PowerShell, use the Azure Management Portal to set up authentication.
trans-unit.target: If you don’t have access to PowerShell, use the Azure Management Portal to set up authentication.

trans-unit.source: You do these steps to set up authentication:
trans-unit.target: You do these steps to set up authentication:

trans-unit.source: Add an application to the Azure Active Directory tenant.
trans-unit.target: Add an application to the Azure Active Directory tenant.

trans-unit.source: Set permissions for the application that you added.
trans-unit.target: Set permissions for the application that you added.

trans-unit.source: Get the token for authenticating requests to Azure Insights.
trans-unit.target: Get the token for authenticating requests to Azure Insights.

trans-unit.source: Use the following information based on your needs:
trans-unit.target: Use the following information based on your needs:

trans-unit.source: Set up authentication using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Set up authentication using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Before you do any of the steps in this section, you need to install these PowerShell modules:
trans-unit.target: Before you do any of the steps in this section, you need to install these PowerShell modules:

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Azure PowerShell Module</legacyBold> - For instructions, see <externalLink><linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/install-configure-powershell/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Azure PowerShell Module</legacyBold> - For instructions, see <externalLink><linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/install-configure-powershell/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Azure Active Directory Module for Windows PowerShell</legacyBold> - For instructions, see <externalLink><linkText>Install the Azure AD Module</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/jj151815.aspx#bkmk_installmodule</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Azure Active Directory Module for Windows PowerShell</legacyBold> - For instructions, see <externalLink><linkText>Install the Azure AD Module</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/jj151815.aspx#bkmk_installmodule</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Add an application to the Azure Active Directory tenant
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Add an application to the Azure Active Directory tenant

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you can access a user account with Global Administrator permissions in an Azure Active Directory tenant.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you can access a user account with Global Administrator permissions in an Azure Active Directory tenant.

trans-unit.source: For information about user accounts, see <externalLink><linkText>Create or edit user</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/hh967632.aspx#BKMK_1</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For information about user accounts, see <externalLink><linkText>Create or edit user</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/hh967632.aspx#BKMK_1</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Run the <externalLink><linkText>Get-Credential</linkText><linkUri>http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh849815.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to set the user account name and password in the PowerShell window:
trans-unit.target: Run the <externalLink><linkText>Get-Credential</linkText><linkUri>http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh849815.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to set the user account name and password in the PowerShell window:

trans-unit.source: Enter the account information when prompted.
trans-unit.target: Enter the account information when prompted.

trans-unit.source: Run the <externalLink><linkText>Connect-MsolService</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn194123.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to connect to Azure Active Directory using the credentials that you just entered:
trans-unit.target: Run the <externalLink><linkText>Connect-MsolService</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn194123.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to connect to Azure Active Directory using the credentials that you just entered:

trans-unit.source: Run the <externalLink><linkText>New-MsolServicePrincipal</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn194119.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to add the application:
trans-unit.target: Run the <externalLink><linkText>New-MsolServicePrincipal</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn194119.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to add the application:

trans-unit.source: You’ll see information about the application after it is successfully created.
trans-unit.target: You’ll see information about the application after it is successfully created.

trans-unit.source: Keep track of the returned application id because you need it to set permissions:
trans-unit.target: Keep track of the returned application id because you need it to set permissions:

trans-unit.source: An Azure Active Directory application is also sometimes referred to as a service principal.
trans-unit.target: An Azure Active Directory application is also sometimes referred to as a service principal.

trans-unit.source: When you create a service principal using the cmdlet, it is not displayed as an application in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: When you create a service principal using the cmdlet, it is not displayed as an application in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: If necessary, a certificate can be used for authentication instead of a password.
trans-unit.target: If necessary, a certificate can be used for authentication instead of a password.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Example 2</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn194119.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Example 2</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn194119.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Set permissions for the application that you added
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Set permissions for the application that you added

trans-unit.source: When you use the Azure PowerShell cmdlets, the Azure module is imported into the session by default.
trans-unit.target: When you use the Azure PowerShell cmdlets, the Azure module is imported into the session by default.

trans-unit.source: To complete the steps to enable authentication, you need to use the AzureResourceManager module.
trans-unit.target: To complete the steps to enable authentication, you need to use the AzureResourceManager module.

trans-unit.source: Run the <externalLink><linkText>Switch-AzureMode</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn722470.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to import the AzureResourceManager module:
trans-unit.target: Run the <externalLink><linkText>Switch-AzureMode</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn722470.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to import the AzureResourceManager module:

trans-unit.source: Run the <externalLink><linkText>Select-AzureSubscription</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn495203.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to make sure you are working with the correct subscription if you manage more than one:
trans-unit.target: Run the <externalLink><linkText>Select-AzureSubscription</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn495203.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to make sure you are working with the correct subscription if you manage more than one:

trans-unit.source: Run the <externalLink><linkText>Get-AzureSubscription</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn495302.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to verify that the subscription is selected.
trans-unit.target: Run the <externalLink><linkText>Get-AzureSubscription</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn495302.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to verify that the subscription is selected.

trans-unit.source: The value of IsCurrent will be true:
trans-unit.target: The value of IsCurrent will be true:

trans-unit.source: Run the New-AzureRoleAssignment cmdlet to assign permissions to the application:
trans-unit.target: Run the New-AzureRoleAssignment cmdlet to assign permissions to the application:

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Get the token for authenticating requests to Azure Insights
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Get the token for authenticating requests to Azure Insights

trans-unit.source: To get a token for authorization, you need to install the Active Directory Authentication Library into your Visual Studio project.
trans-unit.target: To get a token for authorization, you need to install the Active Directory Authentication Library into your Visual Studio project.

trans-unit.source: The easiest way to do this is to use the NuGet package.
trans-unit.target: The easiest way to do this is to use the NuGet package.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the project name in Solution Explorer, and then click <ui>Manage NuGet Packages</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the project name in Solution Explorer, and then click <ui>Manage NuGet Packages</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Type <userInput>Active Directory</userInput> in the search box, click <ui>Install</ui> for the Active Directory Authentication Library package, and then follow the instructions to install it.
trans-unit.target: Type <userInput>Active Directory</userInput> in the search box, click <ui>Install</ui> for the Active Directory Authentication Library package, and then follow the instructions to install it.

trans-unit.source: Use this code to retrieve the token:
trans-unit.target: Use this code to retrieve the token:

trans-unit.source: Replace {tenantId or tenant name} with your tenant information.
trans-unit.target: Replace {tenantId or tenant name} with your tenant information.

trans-unit.source: Replace {application id} with the id from the application that you created.
trans-unit.target: Replace {application id} with the id from the application that you created.

trans-unit.source: Replace {application password} with the password of your application.
trans-unit.target: Replace {application password} with the password of your application.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Get-AzureAccount</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn495234.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet can help you find tenant information.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Get-AzureAccount</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn495234.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet can help you find tenant information.

trans-unit.source: Using the token returned from the method that you just added, set the authorization request header for your REST operation call:
trans-unit.target: Using the token returned from the method that you just added, set the authorization request header for your REST operation call:

trans-unit.source: Set up authentication using the Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Set up authentication using the Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Before you do any of the steps in this section, you need to log into the <externalLink><linkText>Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://manage.windowsazure.com/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Before you do any of the steps in this section, you need to log into the <externalLink><linkText>Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://manage.windowsazure.com/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Add an application to the Azure Active Directory tenant
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Add an application to the Azure Active Directory tenant

trans-unit.source: Towards the bottom of the left menu, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, and then click <ui>Default Directory</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Towards the bottom of the left menu, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, and then click <ui>Default Directory</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the top of the Default Directory page, click <ui>Applications</ui>, on the bottom of the page, click <ui>Add</ui>, and then click <ui>Add an application my organization is developing</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the top of the Default Directory page, click <ui>Applications</ui>, on the bottom of the page, click <ui>Add</ui>, and then click <ui>Add an application my organization is developing</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of the application, select <ui>Native Client Application</ui>, and then click the right arrow.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name of the application, select <ui>Native Client Application</ui>, and then click the right arrow.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Redirect URI for the application, and then click the checkmark.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Redirect URI for the application, and then click the checkmark.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Set permissions for the application that you added
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Set permissions for the application that you added

trans-unit.source: Setting the permissions using the portal causes the user of the application to log in every time a request is made.
trans-unit.target: Setting the permissions using the portal causes the user of the application to log in every time a request is made.

trans-unit.source: You can avoid this action by using the PowerShell steps above if they are available to you.
trans-unit.target: You can avoid this action by using the PowerShell steps above if they are available to you.

trans-unit.source: On the page for your application, click <ui>Configure</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the page for your application, click <ui>Configure</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>permissions for other applications</ui> section at the bottom of the page, click <ui>Add application</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>permissions for other applications</ui> section at the bottom of the page, click <ui>Add application</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Select application</ui>, and then select <ui>Windows Azure Service Management API</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Select application</ui>, and then select <ui>Windows Azure Service Management API</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Delegated Permissions</ui> for the Windows Azure Service Management APIs, and then select <ui>Access Azure Service Management</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Delegated Permissions</ui> for the Windows Azure Service Management APIs, and then select <ui>Access Azure Service Management</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui> on the bottom menu.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui> on the bottom menu.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Get the token for authenticating requests to Azure Resource Manager
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Get the token for authenticating requests to Azure Resource Manager

trans-unit.source: To get a token for authorization, you need to install the Active Directory Authentication Library into your Visual Studio project.
trans-unit.target: To get a token for authorization, you need to install the Active Directory Authentication Library into your Visual Studio project.

trans-unit.source: The easiest way to do this is to use the NuGet package.
trans-unit.target: The easiest way to do this is to use the NuGet package.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the project name in Solution Explorer, and then click <ui>Manage NuGet Packages</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the project name in Solution Explorer, and then click <ui>Manage NuGet Packages</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Type <userInput>Active Directory</userInput> in the search box, click <ui>Install</ui> for the Active Directory Authentication Library package, and then follow the instructions to install it.
trans-unit.target: Type <userInput>Active Directory</userInput> in the search box, click <ui>Install</ui> for the Active Directory Authentication Library package, and then follow the instructions to install it.

trans-unit.source: Use this code to retrieve the token:
trans-unit.target: Use this code to retrieve the token:

trans-unit.source: Replace {tenant id} with your tenant information.
trans-unit.target: Replace {tenant id} with your tenant information.

trans-unit.source: You can find the tenant id in the Management Portal by clicking <ui>View Endpoints</ui> at the bottom of the Configure page for the application:
trans-unit.target: You can find the tenant id in the Management Portal by clicking <ui>View Endpoints</ui> at the bottom of the Configure page for the application:

trans-unit.source: Replace {application id} with the id of the application that you created and {redirect uri} with the uri of your application.
trans-unit.target: Replace {application id} with the id of the application that you created and {redirect uri} with the uri of your application.

trans-unit.source: You can find these settings on the Configure page.
trans-unit.target: You can find these settings on the Configure page.

trans-unit.source: Using the token returned from the method that you just added, set the authorization request header for your REST operation call:
trans-unit.target: Using the token returned from the method that you just added, set the authorization request header for your REST operation call:
